titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Columbia University Catalogs, etc. Cubb.00166
titlestmt.author: Kathy Kerns

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-06-25 18:55:06 -0700.

did.abstract: Located in New York City. Incorporated in 1754 as King's College. Incorporated by New York State in 1784 as Columbia College. Rechartered 1810. In 1896 the Trustees voted to change the name to Columbia University in the City of New York and to designate the School of Arts as Columbia College. Signed agreement with Barnard College in 1898. See also the finding aid for Barnard College.

did.abstract: "Teachers College, founded in 1888 and chartered by the Regents of the University of the State of New York on January 12, 1889, became by an agreement dated March 22, 1898, a part of the educational system of Columbia University."--Teachers College Announcement 1901-1902, p. 15.
